intro: Scrophularia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered figwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly rough texture. Scrophularia grandiflora is often found in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
